contacts.helper

Class CalendarHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • contacts.helper.CalendarHelper

  • public class CalendarHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A class containing helper methods for dealing with Calendar objects. NB. This class actively ignores the time element of Calendar objects (ie. only looks at the year, month and date).

      CalendarHelper()

      • CalendarHelper

        public CalendarHelper()

    • Method Detail

      • isDateInFuture

        public static boolean isDateInFuture(java.util.Calendar date)
        Returns true if the given Calendar date (eg. 1st of January, 2012) is in the future (where today is considered both in the future and in the past). Ie. It ignores the time element of the Calendar object.
        Parameters:
        date - the Calendar object to check
        Returns:
        whether the given Calendar's date is in the future (inclusive of today)

      • isDateInPast

        public static boolean isDateInPast(java.util.Calendar date)
        Returns true if the given Calendar date (eg. 1st of January, 2012) is in the past (where today is considered both in the future and in the past). Ie. It ignores the time element of the Calendar object.
        Parameters:
        date - the Calendar object to check
        Returns:
        whether the given Calendar's date is in the past (inclusive of today)

      • getSimpleCalendarString

        public static java.lang.String getSimpleCalendarString(java.util.Calendar date)
        Gets the string representation of the given Calendar object's calendar date (in UK-standard format), eg. "21/01/2012".
        Parameters:
        date - the Calendar object to extract the date from.
        Returns:
        the string representation of the given date in "dd/MM/yyyy" format.

      • getCalendarFromString

        public static java.util.Calendar getCalendarFromString(java.lang.String date_str)
                                                throws java.text.ParseException
        Given a string formatted as "dd/MM/yyyy" (such as those returned by 'getSimpleCalendarString') this returns a new Calendar object of that date. NB. The time element of the Calendar object is set to the current time.
        Parameters:
        date_str - the string formatted as "dd/MM/yyyy" to extract a date from.
        Returns:
        the Calendar object with the given data.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if the string was not formatted as "dd/MM/yyyy".

      • areDatesEqual

        public static boolean areDatesEqual(java.util.Calendar first,
                    java.util.Calendar second)
        Returns true if the given Calendar objects share the same calendar date, or false otherwise. NB. this ignores the time elements of the objects.
        Parameters:
        first - the first Calendar object to check against the second.
        second - the second Calendar object to check against the first.
        Returns:
        Whether the Calendar objects fall on the same calendar date.
